The values in the matrix correspond to the genetic distances between pairs of taxa.</span></p> <p><span style='font-size: large;'>For example, the distance between <span style="color: #001a66;"><b>taxon Bellen</b></span> and <span style="color: #003f66;"><b>taxon Elwet</b></span> is <b>30</b>. Distances are symmetric, meaning that both the distance between <span style="color: #003f66;"><b>taxon Elwet</b></span> and <span style="color: #408000;"><b>taxon Manticore</b></span> is <b>22</b> and the distance between <span style="color: #408000;"><b>taxon Manticore</b></span> and <span style="color: #003f66;"><b>taxon Elwet</b></span> is <b>22</b>.</span></p><p><span style='font-size: large;'>Using this distance matrix, determine the most appropriate gene tree that accurately reflects the relationships and distances between these taxa.</span></p>	A. <table style="border-collapse: collapse; The values in the matrix correspond to the genetic distances between pairs of taxa.</span></p> <p><span style='font-size: large;'>For example, the distance between <span style="color: #001a66;"><b>taxon Bellen</b></span> and <span style="color: #003f66;"><b>taxon Elwet</b></span> is <b>24</b>. Distances are symmetric, meaning that both the distance between <span style="color: #003f66;"><b>taxon Elwet</b></span> and <span style="color: #424d57;"><b>taxon Kraken</b></span> is <b>30</b> and the distance between <span style="color: #424d57;"><b>taxon Kraken</b></span> and <span style="color: #003f66;"><b>taxon Elwet</b></span> is <b>30</b>.</span></p><p><span style='font-size: large;'>Using this distance matrix, determine the most appropriate gene tree that accurately reflects the relationships and distances between these taxa.</span></p>	A. <table style="border-collapse: collapse; The values in the matrix correspond to the genetic distances between pairs of taxa.</span></p> <p><span style='font-size: large;'>For example, the distance between <span style="color: #001a66;"><b>taxon Bellen</b></span> and <span style="color: #006600;"><b>taxon Hydra</b></span> is <b>40</b>. Distances are symmetric, meaning that both the distance between <span style="color: #006600;"><b>taxon Hydra</b></span> and <span style="color: #008040;"><b>taxon Thorret</b></span> is <b>42</b> and the distance between <span style="color: #008040;"><b>taxon Thorret</b></span> and <span style="color: #006600;"><b>taxon Hydra</b></span> is <b>42</b>.</span></p><p><span style='font-size: large;'>Using this distance matrix, determine the most appropriate gene tree that accurately reflects the relationships and distances between these taxa.</span></p>	A. <table style="border-collapse: collapse; The values in the matrix correspond to the genetic distances between pairs of taxa.</span></p> <p><span style='font-size: large;'>For example, the distance between <span style="color: #661a00;"><b>taxon Ashen</b></span> and <span style="color: #3d3d5c;"><b>taxon Narloc</b></span> is <b>30</b>. Distances are symmetric, meaning that both the distance between <span style="color: #3d3d5c;"><b>taxon Narloc</b></span> and <span style="color: #6c1414;"><b>taxon Rynoth</b></span> is <b>42</b> and the distance between <span style="color: #6c1414;"><b>taxon Rynoth</b></span> and <span style="color: #3d3d5c;"><b>taxon Narloc</b></span> is <b>42</b>.</span></p><p><span style='font-size: large;'>Using this distance matrix, determine the most appropriate gene tree that accurately reflects the relationships and distances between these taxa.</span></p>	A. <table style="border-collapse: collapse; The values in the matrix correspond to the genetic distances between pairs of taxa.</span></p> <p><span style='font-size: large;'>For example, the distance between <span style="color: #664b00;"><b>taxon Chimera</b></span> and <span style="color: #802200;"><b>taxon Phoenix</b></span> is <b>36</b>. Distances are symmetric, meaning that both the distance between <span style="color: #802200;"><b>taxon Phoenix</b></span> and <span style="color: #008040;"><b>taxon Thorret</b></span> is <b>4</b> and the distance between <span style="color: #008040;"><b>taxon Thorret</b></span> and <span style="color: #802200;"><b>taxon Phoenix</b></span> is <b>4</b>.</span></p><p><span style='font-size: large;'>Using this distance matrix, determine the most appropriate gene tree that accurately reflects the relationships and distances between these taxa.</span></p>	A. <table style="border-collapse: collapse; The values in the matrix correspond to the genetic distances between pairs of taxa.</span></p> <p><span style='font-size: large;'>For example, the distance between <span style="color: #664b00;"><b>taxon Chimera</b></span> and <span style="color: #006600;"><b>taxon Hydra</b></span> is <b>28</b>. Distances are symmetric, meaning that both the distance between <span style="color: #006600;"><b>taxon Hydra</b></span> and <span style="color: #49361d;"><b>taxon Jackalope</b></span> is <b>40</b> and the distance between <span style="color: #49361d;"><b>taxon Jackalope</b></span> and <span style="color: #006600;"><b>taxon Hydra</b></span> is <b>40</b>.</span></p><p><span style='font-size: large;'>Using this distance matrix, determine the most appropriate gene tree that accurately reflects the relationships and distances between these taxa.</span></p>	A. <table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>aced_8ffd</p> <table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 610px; height: 235px"><caption style="caption-side:bottom">4 taxa &times; 4 taxa distance matrix</caption><colgroup width="100"/><colgroup width="100"/><colgroup width="100"/><colgroup width="100"/><colgroup width="100"/><tr><td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">taxa</td><th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;" bgcolor="#b3c6ff"><span style="font-size: large; color: #424d57;">Kraken</span></th><td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;" bgcolor="#fafff2"><span style="font-size: large;">14</span></td><td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;" bgcolor="#f2fff2"><span style="font-size: large;">2</span></td><td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;" bgcolor="#fff8f2"><span style="font-size: large;">30</span></td><td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;" bgcolor="DarkGray">&times;</td></tr></table><p><span style='font-size: large;'>The table above represents a distance matrix for the following taxa: <b><span style="color: #001a66;">Bellen</span></b>, <b><span style="color: #003f66;">Elwet</span></b>, <b><span style="color: #49361d;">Jackalope</span></b>, <b><span style="color: #424d57;">Kraken</span></b>. The values in the matrix correspond to the genetic distances between pairs of taxa.</span></p> <p><span style='font-size: large;'>For example, the distance between <span style="color: #001a66;"><b>taxon Bellen</b></span> and <span style="color: #003f66;"><b>taxon Elwet</b></span> is <b>22</b>. Distances are symmetric, meaning that both the distance between <span style="color: #003f66;"><b>taxon Elwet</b></span> and <span style="color: #49361d;"><b>taxon Jackalope</b></span> is <b>38</b> and the distance between <span style="color: #49361d;"><b>taxon Jackalope</b></span> and <span style="color: #003f66;"><b>taxon Elwet</b></span> is <b>38</b>.</span></p><p><span style='font-size: large;'>Using this distance matrix, determine the most appropriate gene tree that accurately reflects the relationships and distances between these taxa.</span></p>	A. <table style="border-collapse: collapse; The values in the matrix correspond to the genetic distances between pairs of taxa.</span></p> <p><span style='font-size: large;'>For example, the distance between <span style="color: #664b00;"><b>taxon Chimera</b></span> and <span style="color: #006600;"><b>taxon Hydra</b></span> is <b>34</b>. Distances are symmetric, meaning that both the distance between <span style="color: #006600;"><b>taxon Hydra</b></span> and <span style="color: #424d57;"><b>taxon Kraken</b></span> is <b>38</b> and the distance between <span style="color: #424d57;"><b>taxon Kraken</b></span> and <span style="color: #006600;"><b>taxon Hydra</b></span> is <b>38</b>.</span></p><p><span style='font-size: large;'>Using this distance matrix, determine the most appropriate gene tree that accurately reflects the relationships and distances between these taxa.</span></p>	A. <table style="border-collapse: collapse; The values in the matrix correspond to the genetic distances between pairs of taxa.</span></p> <p><span style='font-size: large;'>For example, the distance between <span style="color: #006600;"><b>taxon Hydra</b></span> and <span style="color: #424d57;"><b>taxon Kraken</b></span> is <b>28</b>. Distances are symmetric, meaning that both the distance between <span style="color: #424d57;"><b>taxon Kraken</b></span> and <span style="color: #3d3d5c;"><b>taxon Narloc</b></span> is <b>30</b> and the distance between <span style="color: #3d3d5c;"><b>taxon Narloc</b></span> and <span style="color: #424d57;"><b>taxon Kraken</b></span> is <b>30</b>.</span></p><p><span style='font-size: large;'>Using this distance matrix, determine the most appropriate gene tree that accurately reflects the relationships and distances between these taxa.</span></p>	A. <table style="border-collapse: collapse;
